introduction: There are cosmic snipers firing at random into the universe. What are they and what happens if they

vocabulary.definition: causing the formation of ions by removing electrons from atoms
vocabulary.example: Ionizing radiation can be harmful to living organisms by disrupting cellular functions.
The radioactive material was emitting dangerous levels of radiation.

vocabulary.definition: made magnetic, possessing the properties of a magnet
vocabulary.example: The magnetized particles were attracted to the magnetic field.

vocabulary.definition: relating to or denoting a violent natural event
vocabulary.example: The earthquake was a cataclysmic event that caused widespread destruction.

vocabulary.definition: lacking in life, unable to produce offspring or results
vocabulary.example: The environment became sterile after the chemical spill.

vocabulary.definition: friendly and welcoming to visitors or guests
vocabulary.example: The local community was hospitable and offered us food and shelter.
